hooks.prompt:
A Bash command is about to run. Check $ARGUMENTS for dangerous patterns:
- rm -rf / or ~ or .
- sudo rm
- curl|wget piped to sh/bash
- git push --force
- git reset --hard
- DROP DATABASE/TABLE
- chmod -R 777
- Production deploys (vercel --prod, railway deploy, npm publish, fly deploy, heroku push, aws deploy, gcloud deploy)

If dangerous: {"ok": false, "reason": "Blocked: <pattern>. Requires manual approval."}
If production deploy: {"ok": true, "reason": "Production deployment detected. Confirm with user before proceeding."}
Otherwise: {"ok": true}

IBR (Interface Built Right) is installed — it's a UI decision context system, not just a comparison tool. A Playwright screenshot/snapshot is being called. IBR tracks UI decisions, provides context for all visual work, and does visual regression testing. Respond: {"ok": true, "reason": "Consider using IBR: npx ibr start <url> for session tracking and UI decision context."}

Check $ARGUMENTS for the file path. If it's a UI file (.tsx, .jsx, .vue, .svelte, .css, .scss, or in components/, pages/, app/ directories), respond: {"ok": true, "reason": "UI file detected. IBR tracks UI decisions — after changes, run: npx ibr check to verify and record this change in the decision context."}. If it targets a sensitive path (/etc/, /usr/, ~/.ssh/, ~/.aws/, ~/.gnupg/, ~/.npmrc, ~/.netrc, ~/.gitconfig), respond: {"ok": false, "reason": "Write to sensitive system path blocked."}. Otherwise: {"ok": true}

A file was just edited. Check $ARGUMENTS for the file path. If it's a UI file (.tsx, .jsx, .vue, .svelte, .css, .scss), respond: {"ok": true, "reason": "UI file modified. IBR is tracking this as a UI decision. Verify with: npx ibr check"}. Otherwise: {"ok": true}

Session ending. Check $ARGUMENTS for evidence of UI work (.tsx/.jsx/.vue/.svelte edits, UI keywords). If UI work was done, check if IBR was used (look for 'npx ibr', 'Element Audit', 'session:screenshot', 'decision-tracker'). If UI work done but IBR NOT used: {"ok": true, "reason": "UI changes detected but IBR context not captured. Consider: npx ibr check to record these decisions."}. Otherwise: {"ok": true}

IBR (Interface Built Right) is active — your UI decision context system. IBR tracks all UI decisions, provides visual regression testing, and maintains context across sessions. Respond: {"ok": true, "reason": "IBR ready. It tracks UI decisions, not just comparisons. Use npx ibr start <url> for sessions, npx ibr check for verification."}
